text: 'This sushi is some of the best quality in Hoboken; plus it‚Äôs BYOB. I‚Äôve tried almost every sushi place here and this is the best bang for your buck. The fish pieces are large
column5: prices aren‚Äôt horrible and the quality is there each time. They always have to go orders ready in 10-25 minutes and a huge menu to choose from with amazing special roll options. The service could be better if you choose to go sit down but if you‚Äôre ordering this is the best option. I‚Äôve been ordering from them for over 2 years now and it never disappoints.'

author: Melanie Tam
text: 'Pretty solid takeout sushi option for Hoboken area. My order came on time
column5: even in a thunderstorm. I had the three roll special - white tuna (my fave)
column6: tuna
column7: and salmon. The fish was good - fish to rice ratio was perfect. This special came with your choice of soup or salad. I decided to go with the "hibachi soup"
column8: which has scallions and mushrooms. It\'s pretty salty
column9: so you\'re better off getting a miso soup or just a side salad. Prices are on par with other Hoboken sushi spots. Is it amazing sushi? No. Will it suffice if you\'re craving sushi? For sure. Would def order from here again.'

author: Alex Grin
text: "I'm never too picky and don't usually write reviews
column5: but as I write this I am mildly nauseas. I had a Volcano Roll and Japanese noodles along with a kani salad. The kani salad was bland compared to kani salad I've had in multiple places (cheaper ones too). The noodles tasted raw and extremely bland while the Volcano Roll came with hair. The waiter took it away and got me another. Which brings me to a final point
column6: the service time was awful. Besides my friend and I there was 1 other table. Even so
column7: the waiter took her time taking our order and not once were we given or offered a refill of our tea. Honestly ruined my day
column8: I can't believe I actually paid money for this."
